thread.title: Afghan actress urges Afghan women to keep working
thread.title_full: Afghan actress urges Afghan women to keep working

title: Afghan actress urges Afghan women to keep working
text: > Entertainment Afghan actress urges Afghan women to keep working Afghan actress Marina Gulbahari speaks during an interview at the Busan International Film Festival in Busan, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. South Korea. When Gulbahari walked the red carpet on the first night of Asiaâ€™s largest film festival, she showed the world more than the colorful traditional Afghan dress she was wearing. She showed the world the face of women in Afghanistan. "For the moment, living in Afghanistan is difficult for normal people. For women who are working as an actress, it's more dangerous for them," she said in an interview translated by her husband Noorullah Azizi, who works in movie and TV production in Afghanistan. "About some years ago (I) got some warnings from the Taliban that you cannot work. If you appear again, we will kill you." (AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon)
